New Records: Kyle Hendricks became the first Cubs pitcher in history to toss at least six innings while allowing two or fewer hits and one or fewer runs in a start at Coors Field.
Key Match Events: The Cubs had opportunities to blow the game open, leaving 16 runners on base and going 3-for-14 with runners in scoring position.
Michael Busch delivered the first multi-homer game of his career in Sunday's win, part of a three-hit day for his third such game of the trip.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs return home as their chances of making the postseason remain bleak. It would require a historic comeback concurrent with an epic collapse by the Atlanta Braves and New York Mets for the final National League wild-card spot.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Craig Counsell said, 'We left a small farming village in central Illinois with runners on base, but we played good offense.'
Counsell also mentioned that Isaac Paredes' approach lately has reflected the plate discipline he's been known for in his career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kyle Hendricks makes potentially his last starts with the Chicago Cubs ahead of his impending free agency.
Isaac Paredes is locked in and showing the offensive production the Cubs expected when they acquired him from the Tampa Bay Rays before the trade deadline.
Others: The article discusses the Chicago Cubs' 6-2 victory over the Colorado Rockies, with Kyle Hendricks showing his best stuff of the season and the Cubs avoiding the sweep.
